---

### 2. File merging strategy discussion

**Context**: Designed intelligent agent-driven merging for DX-79

**Why it worked**:
- Recognized that mechanical similarity matching (Jaccard index) wastes agent capability
- Agent semantic understanding is superior for identifying duplicate issues
- Discussion revealed cross-project awareness is non-issue (each project has independent .invar/)

**Key insight**:
> "Agent intelligence > mechanical rules. Why use keyword matching when LLM can understand 'Guard slow' â‰ˆ 'Guard timeout'?"

---

### 3. Iterative proposal refinement

**What changed**:
- Removed max_per_day frequency cap (too restrictive)
- Replaced similarity threshold with agent-driven merging
- Added detailed examples of merged feedback documents

**User experience**:
> "Discussion-driven refinement works well. User questions revealed design gaps (frequency cap, cross-project) that needed addressing."
